simulation.population

Class SquareLatticePopulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulation.population.SquareLatticePopulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Population

    public class SquareLatticePopulation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Population
    A class structuring agents in a square lattice-like graph described in "Evolutionary language competition - an agent-based model" paper.

    In this kind of population, agents can be seen as though they were structured in a two dimensional array of dimensions n x m. Let an agent a be in position [i, j] (i-th row and j-th column). An edge connecting this agent with another agent b is of weight 1.0 + epsilon if and only if b's position is [i+1, j], [i-1, j], [i, j+1] or [i, j-1]; otherwise it is of weight epsilon. In other words, an edge connecting any two neighbouring in the array agents is of weight 1.0 + epsilon, and of weight epsilon otherwise.

    See Also:
    ELCPaperSimulationCreator

      • SquareLatticePopulation

        public SquareLatticePopulation(Agent[] agents,
                               int side,
                               double epsilon)
        Initializes this population with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        agents - an array of agents to be structured in square lattice
        side - the first dimension of this population's lattice, the second is calculated as agents.length/side
        epsilon - an additional weight added to weight of edge between any two agents
